body_html:
The README.md is currently up-to-date. We should, as you indicate, update DEVELOPMENT.md. I'll just go ahead and do this in our new repository at https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorboard. Thanks for reporting.

As to development environments, it's just everyone's own taste; we don't have a single unified setup. In fact, we're all quite different: I believe we've got Linux with vim, Linux/Mac with Sublime, Linux on emacs/IntelliJ, and using a Google-internal web IDE. :-)
body_text:
The README.md is currently up-to-date. We should, as you indicate, update DEVELOPMENT.md. I'll just go ahead and do this in our new repository at https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorboard. Thanks for reporting.
As to development environments, it's just everyone's own taste; we don't have a single unified setup. In fact, we're all quite different: I believe we've got Linux with vim, Linux/Mac with Sublime, Linux on emacs/IntelliJ, and using a Google-internal web IDE. :-)
body:
[The `README.md` is currently up-to-date.](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorboard/blob/master/README.md#usage) We should, as you indicate, update `DEVELOPMENT.md`. I'll just go ahead and do this in our new repository at https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorboard. Thanks for reporting.

As to development environments, it's just everyone's own taste; we don't have a single unified setup. In fact, we're all quite different: I believe we've got Linux with vim, Linux/Mac with Sublime, Linux on emacs/IntelliJ, and using a Google-internal web IDE. :-)
